result.execSummary:
The defendant Alisha Margaret Hoag was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today March 23, 2015 before leaving Hudson Wisconsin.
Bond is continued until Defendant reports to Probation and then will be discharged.
Court approves Probation to be transferred to Minnesota.
Court notes 16 days credit if Defendant is revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF96.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF96.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: for Release/Modification/Change in Sentence. Approved for 5 days. Signed by EJL on 10/30/2015. km
Filed by J. Theisen. Re: treatment of Def. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, DOC: Stephanie Engel, Alisha Margaret Hoag pro se.  Court called at 2:37 p.m.  DOC is asking to modify the DE's probation to include jail so that she can go through an AODA program.  Court modifies probation and orders 90 days Jail in the St. Croix County Jail starting 08/14/15.  Court orders the other conditions of probation to remain the same.  Court adjourned.  lw
Filed by Agent Engel. Re: status of Def. km
Def's copy of JOC returned from PO; No such number. km
Appointing Atty Kucinski. km
c: DOC. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & E: Probation. eif
filed by ADA Alexis McKinley. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A Kucinski, DF: Alisha Margaret Hoag appeared from jail.  Court called at 10:36 a.m.  Set for arraignment.  Attorney Kucinski advises the court there is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1.  Court enters a No Contest Plea.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjuticated guilty of Ct 1. Sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  Crt Orders:

S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- AODA with follow through
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs of $268 and DNA Surcharge of $250 through DOC
- Court approves probation to be transfered to Minnesota
- DE to report to probation by today before leaving Hudson Wisconsin
- Bail is continued until DE reports to probation and then bail will be vacated

- 20 days to appeal
If DE is revoked 16 days credit for jail.
Arraignment on March 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Alisha Margaret Hoag appeared from jail.  Court called at 2:38 p.m.  S/T of Sgt. Jeff Kennett of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Office.  Direct by ADA Mckinley.  DE is identified by Sgt Kennett.  Cross by Attorney Kucinski.  Witness is excused.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Set out for arraignment.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 2:50 p.m.  lw  Arraignment scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Alisha Margaret Hoag appeared from jail. Atty Kucinski states Defendant is unable to post bail. Bond continues in form and amount.

Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on March 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
